meanings.definition: Smooth out or straighten (something that is crumpled)
meanings.sent1: I carefully uncrumple the paper to make it flat again.
meanings.sent2: She used an iron to uncrumple her wrinkled shirt.
meanings.sent3: After the cat sat on it, I had to uncrumple my homework.
meanings.sent4: Her gentle touch seemed to uncrumple the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: With a few swift movements, he managed to uncrumple the map and reveal the hidden treasure.

meanings.definition: Become smooth or straight after being crumpled
meanings.sent1: The fabric will uncrumple once it is washed and dried.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the pages of the book will uncrumple on their own.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick caused the paper to uncrumple before our eyes.
meanings.sent4: As the tension eased, her face started to uncrumple into a smile.
meanings.sent5: The warm sun helped uncrumple the petals of the flower, making it bloom beautifully.
